title: Can An Anti-Fracking Ballot Question Change Balance Of Power In Washington?
teaser: Colorado Democrats worry that upcoming ballot initiatives on fracking may increase Republican voter turnout in the November elections.
contentencoded:
Colorado Democrat Rep. Jared Polis is pushing a statewide ballot initiative that restricts oil and gas fracking locations in ways that the industry says would make drilling virtually impossible in the state.

Vulnerable Colorado Democrats up for re-election in November, such as Senator Mark Udall, are worried the ballot question will bring Republican opponents out to the polls to vote. If Udall loses, the Democrats could lose control of the Senate in Washington.

Voter signatures for two ballot questions that Congressman Polis is supporting are due on Monday.

Megan Verlee of Colorado Public Radio joins Here & Now’s Jeremy Hobson with details.

Guest

  • Megan Verlee, reporter for Colorado Public Radio, part of the Here & Now Contributors Network. She tweets @CPRverlee.
